intro: Terpnanthus jasminoides, commonly known as the golden dewdrop, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble small drops of dew. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous annual, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, while the flowers are clustered in umbels. Terpnanthus jasminoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
